quote-source: Tara C. Marshall. Facebook Surveillance of Former Romantic Partners: Associations with PostBreakup Recovery and Personal Growth, Cyberpsychology, Behavior, and Social Networking, ahead of print.
quote-text: Analysis of the data provided by 464 participants revealed that Facebook surveillance [of ex-partners] was associated with greater current distress over the breakup, more negative feelings, sexual desire, and longing for the ex-partner, and lower personal growth. Participants who remained Facebook friends with the ex-partner, relative to those who did not remain Facebook friends, reported less negative feelings, sexual desire, and longing for the former partner, but lower personal growth. [..] Overall, these findings suggest that exposure to an ex-partner through Facebook may obstruct the process of healing and moving on from a past relationship.
